alert.note: Alert for East Cameron; Southern Calcasieu (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 10 at 7:32PM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Cameron and southeastern Calcasieu Parishes through 815 PM CDT... At 732 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Lake Charles Regional Airport, moving south at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lake Charles, Grand Lake, Lake Charles Regional Airport, Hacketts Corner, Heberts Marina, Sweet Lake and Holmwood. This includes Interstate 210 between mile markers 3 and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
